Package factories

Class ResourceLoader

java.lang.Object
factories.ResourceLoader
public class ResourceLoader
extends java.lang.Object
This is the resource loader Provides a friendly interface for loading images into memory it also caches and prevents the same resource to loaded twice

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ResourceLoader​(Logger logger)
    The constructor

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static java.lang.String getBulletResource()  
    java.lang.String getRandomDroneResource()
    Returns a random Drone resource , this needs to be used in combination with a small example will make this clear randomResource -> drone01 loadResource("drone01",new Vector(1,2,3)); -> drone01-3 (the first drone , the third image(1 smallest , 5 biggest))
    static java.lang.String getTurretResource()  
    javafx.scene.image.Image loadResource​(java.lang.String resourceName)
    Loads a resource(an image) from resources/png file
    javafx.scene.image.Image loadResource​(AbstractObject o)
    Loads the proper resource based in the AbstractObject's height as the height increases , the size of the object increases too , this method takes care of it and it ensures that every drone gets dynamically the proper sprite
    void setLogger​(Logger logger)
    Sets the logger (used to print logs into the gui screen)
    static ResourceLoader siglenton()
    returns the instance (not safe,returns null if not initialized)
    static ResourceLoader siglentonInitializer()
    Initializes the singleton instance of the loader

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • ResourceLoader

      public ResourceLoader​(Logger logger) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      The constructor
      Parameters:
      logger - the default logger to print logs (may be the terminal or a gui view)
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the broken.png did not found under the resources/internal folder

  • Method Details

    • siglentonInitializer

      public static ResourceLoader siglentonInitializer() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Initializes the singleton instance of the loader
      Returns:
      the newrly created instance of loader
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - ONLY IF the not found image is not found

      public void setLogger​(Logger logger)
      Sets the logger (used to print logs into the gui screen)

    • loadResource

      public javafx.scene.image.Image loadResource​(java.lang.String resourceName)
      Loads a resource(an image) from resources/png file
      Parameters:
      resourceName - the file name without the extension(!!!)
      Returns:
      the javafx.Image object

    • loadResource

      public javafx.scene.image.Image loadResource​(AbstractObject o)
      Loads the proper resource based in the AbstractObject's height as the height increases , the size of the object increases too , this method takes care of it and it ensures that every drone gets dynamically the proper sprite
      Parameters:
      o - the AbstractObject to get the information from
      Returns:
      the proper representing image for this AbstractObject

    • getRandomDroneResource

      public java.lang.String getRandomDroneResource()
      Returns a random Drone resource , this needs to be used in combination with a small example will make this clear randomResource -> drone01 loadResource("drone01",new Vector(1,2,3)); -> drone01-3 (the first drone , the third image(1 smallest , 5 biggest))
      Returns:
      a string with the resource name(not the full name though , for the full name we need .loadResource to get the proper sprite(with the proper height))
      See Also:
      loadResource(AbstractObject)

    • getBulletResource

      public static java.lang.String getBulletResource()
      Returns:
      the bullets resource name

    • getTurretResource

      public static java.lang.String getTurretResource()
      Returns:
      the turret resource name
